intro: Euploca mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican euploca, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Euploca mexicana is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
